In particular footprint of Shaft at Albert College Park should be reduced, if possible. Property Owners Compensation Scheme should be made more flexible, financial limit raised and inflation proofed.
DPOs Lobbied: Paul McAuliffe|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Briege MacOscar|Councillor|Dublin City Council
Subject Matter: Related my views to Councillor MacOscar on TII Metrolonk proposals. While very supportive of project over all. I had concerns about impact of construction on environs and communities. These should be reduced and kept to minimum. In particular footprint of Shaft at Albert College Park should be reduced, if possible. Property Owners Compensation Scheme should be made more flexible, financial limit raised and inflation proofed.
Intended Results: To relay my views to Councillor MacOscar on Transport Infrastruture Ireland's Metrolink proposals and in particular to inform the submission made by Deputy Paul McAuliffe at the Bord Pleanala Oral Hearing on TII's Metrolink application.
Lobbying Activities: Albert College Park is an historic park run under the auspices of Dublin City Council, located off the Ballymun Road in Glasnevin, Dublin 9. |Informal communication|1
